page.title: 19AMENITIES IN THE EGMERE AREA
page.content: Amenities in the area are few. The North Norfolk District Council is responsible for the region. They provide the service of emptying septic tanks, most premises having modern sanitation. They also provide the weekly refuse collection. Mains water is supplied (through the Anglian Water Board). A postal service is ,of course, provided. There is one public telephone. The nearest doctors' surgery is two miles away and the hospital twenty miles. All interviewed said that the emergency services gave very good service. Pupils go from Egmere to Walsingham C.P. by taxi or to Wells High School by coach. There are no shops. A mobile library and grocer's van visits Egmere. Milk, bread and coal are delivered to the houses regularly.
